page.title: 09Ashurst School
page.content:
Ashurst School was opened in 1872. The local education authority wished to close the tiny school in 1969 but a vigorous local campaign saved it and it has in fact grown somewhat in size since then and now florishes with a fine reputation. The adjacent School House, once the Headmaster's house, has been brought into use as part of the school complex. The school today has 40 pupils in two classes: 21 in an all age infant class and 19 in an all age junior class.
There are two full time teachers and a Headmaster as well as a school secratary. The present headmaster has served for 9 years: his two fore runners for 33 and 38 years. (CONT.)
